extendedIngredients.name: tuna
extendedIngredients.original: 600 g tuna, sliced in two chunky steaks
extendedIngredients.originalName: tuna, sliced in two chunky steaks

title: Loving Tuna: A New Year's Revolution
summary: Loving Tuna: A New Year's Revolution might be just the main course you are searching for. This caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal recipe serves 2 and costs $2.44 per serving. One serving contains 740 calories, 89g of protein, and 39g of fat. This recipe is liked by 12 foodies and cooks. It will be a hit at your new year eve event. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes about 30 minutes. Head to the store and pick up pepper, tuna, marjoram, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the extra virgin olive oil you could follow this main course with the Peach Crisp: Healthy Crisp for Breakfast as a dessert. With a spoonacular score of 95%, this dish is awesome. Try French Revolution, A Salt Revolution, and Kosher Revolution's Be-All, End-All Chicken Soup for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Merlot, Pinot Noir, and rosé Wine are my top picks for Tuna. Though fish is often paired with white wine, 'meatier' fish like tuna can absolutely go with red wine. A Rosé will also pair nicely, particularly if your tunan is prepared with ingredients better suited to a white wine. One wine you could try is Maddalena Merlot. It has 4.8 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 19 dollars.

productMatches.title: Maddalena Merlot
productMatches.description: Maddalena Merlot offers aromas of ripe fruit and oak spice with hints of vanilla and anise. Ripe fruit flavors include bright plum and raspberry. Fruit flavors greet the palate and soft tannins frame the fresh texture that coats the mouth.
